name: ilmenite - magnetite mine operation | magnetite | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8168/documentation

Ilmenite and magnetite mining from hard-rock ore. Based on Tellnes mine (Norway) and Lac Allard mine (Canada).;Comments on modelling. All the flows related to energy consumption are based on U.S. Department of Energy survay from 2007 on Mining Industry (http://www1.eere.energy.gov/manufacturing/industries_technologies/mining/pdfs/mining_bandwidth.pdf). The emissions are based on limestone quarry operation and production datasets. The land use and occupation is based on rough measurements from map.

This activities includes both mining operation and beneficiation. This activity includes blasting, all transports within the mine (for mining and recultivation) and the infrastructure. The primary processing is part of the activity as well; crushing, washing, grinding, separation and transportation by conveyor belt.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/07:Mining of metal ores/072:Mining of non-ferrous metal ores/0729:Mining of other non-ferrous metal ores

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data on energy consumption are based on survey of mining operation sites in the U.S. This data are considered to be representative for the global activity.

exchanges.description: Based on data from Geological survay of Norway (http://www.ngu.no/filearchive/102/bulletin436_3.pdf) and Geological survay of Canada (http://apps1.gdr.nrcan.gc.ca/gsc_minerals/gquerycache/vticanada/DP/dp51.html) the amount of magnetite produced is approximatelly the same as the amount of ilmenite produced.

exchanges.description: Area of Tellnes mine (Norway) and Allard mine (Canada).

flow.name: Transformation, to mineral extraction site
flow.category: Elementary flows/Resource/land

exchanges.description: There are two mines, where hard-ore ilmenite is being mined (Cardarelli, 2008, Materials Handbook); Tellnes mine in Norway (http://www.ngu.no/filearchive/102/bulletin436_3.pdf) and Allard Lake mine in Canada (http://apps1.gdr.nrcan.gc.ca/gsc_minerals/gquerycache/vticanada/DP/dp51.html). The annual production of these mines is 550,000 ton of ilmenite/year, respectivelly 100,000 ton of ilmenite/year. Since magnetite is produced in the same amounts the production volume is estimated to be the same as in case of ilmenite. The lifetime of hard-rock ilmenite mine is estimated to be 100 years. Both of these mines are in operation for more than 50 years and there are no signs of possible closing of the mines.

exchanges.description: 72% Fe in magnetite; 14% Fe in ore; Based on Tellnes mine (58°20', 6°25') in Norway. The iron content of hard-rock ore from this mine is 18% (expressed as FeO) (Korneliussen, 2000, An overview of titanium deposits in Norway). Which means, that the pure iron content is (0.18*0.77=) 14% (based on molecular mass).
